It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, woody fruits. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as heathlands and sandy soils. Parablechnum stipitellatum is adapted to arid conditions and has a low-growing habit to conserve moisture.
